sentence: Consumer products maker The Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) on Thursday saw its earnings estimates lowered by analysts at Goldman Sachs.
The firm said it cut its estimates on PG through 2013, citing higher commodity costs that could eat into its bottom line.
Still, Goldman maintained its "Buy" rating and $75 price target, which suggests a 21% upside to the stock's Wednesday closing price of $61.97.
Procter & Gamble shares were mostly flat in premarket trading Thursday.
Shares of Procter & Gamble ( PG ) have a 3.11% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $61.97.
We have been recommending shares of Procter & Gamble ( PG ) since Sept.1,2009, when the stock was trading at $54.11.
